intro: Humularia katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga humularia, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs known for their medicinal properties. The plant features compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds upon maturity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
